Audits.AuditDetail: No evidence was presented of the annual revision of the technical specifications of supplies according to what is established in the BAP standard. Reference: box 70 lbs of polystyrene, Technical sheet Linthern VAC D 140 - background, (November 2013), Technical sheet lid Linvac 90 N (November 2013).
Audits.LongName: Specifications shall be kept up-to-date and periodically reviewed (which shall occur at a minimum, annually).  Specifications shall be readily available for reference by designated personnel.
Audits.Question: Specifications shall be kept up-to-date and periodically reviewed (which shall occur at a minimum, annually).  Specifications shall be readily available for reference by designated personnel.

Audits.AuditDetail:
The Applicant has Corrective and preventive action procedure V 01 1/25/17. 

No evidence of documented corrective action was presented for the case of unfavorable presence of total coliforms (3 cfu / cm2) in manipulator, according to report # 45595 (02/23/17).
Audits.LongName: The Applicant shall ensure that procedures for the determination and implementation of corrective action, in the event of any significant non-conformity, are prepared and documented.   These shall cover the full scope of the BAP standard (including its Annexes) and shall also address how future reoccurrences will be prevented.

Audits.AuditDetail: Regarding the proper use of the PPE supplied by the organization, there was no evidence of the use of goggles by personnel carrying out activities of sharpening Baader knives and in process in the washing room.
Audits.LongName: Safe, appropriate and hygienic protective gear shall be provided, free of charge, to workers commensurate with work activity.
Audits.Question: Safe, appropriate and hygienic protective gear shall be provided, free of charge, to workers commensurate with work activity.
Audits.Suppliers: High Liner Foods, Inc. Supplier,Seattle Fish Company,Vita Foods-Supplier

Audits.AuditDetail:
Analysis for evidence of foreign matter in HACCP plan, with control measures implemented.                                                                           Metal Policy prohibits the entry of metallic artefacts into the plant.                                                                                                                           Only used in final product platforms (pallet's), which have been analyzed for risks assessment. Pallets are under visual inspection prior to use, and are destined to a secluded place for disposal.
Regarding the control of glass and brittle material, it was evidenced: Standard operating procedures. Inventory of micas and luminaires Ed 08 (08/17/17), includes location, number and responsible, daily check.                                                                                                                                                            The organization has metal detectors for monitoring metal trace in the product, which are part of the preventive maintenance program.  The HACCP plan of the organization identify the metal detector as a CCP. The product is packed in case deposited via conveyor belts to a metal detection system which operates with a calibrated sensor for detecting any metallic piece having a size less than or equal to Detector finished product: Fe: 5.0 mm, S/S: 7.0 mm, Non Fe: 4.0 mm; Detector Portions (retail bag unit): Fe: 5.0 mm, S/S: 5.0 mm, Non Fe: 3.5 mm.  Continuous inspection, registration every 2 hours or product change.
The MD rejection system is: detention of the conveyor, is verified in each monitoring.  
The product committed is investigated and dealt with protocol defined for the treatment of potentially unsafe product.



There was no evidence of monitoring applied brittle material such as: mirrors, vector equipment, wall clock.
Audits.LongName: There shall be a foreign materials prevention program (or series of separate programs), that prevents contamination from all forms of foreign material.  Including but not limited to paint, wood, glass plastic, metal, hair, rust, and so forth.
Audits.Question: There shall be a foreign materials prevention program (or series of separate programs), that prevents contamination from all forms of foreign material.  Including but not limited to paint, wood, glass plastic, metal, hair, rust, and so forth.
Audits.Suppliers: High Liner Foods, Inc. Supplier,Seattle Fish Company,Vita Foods-Supplier

Audits.AuditDetail: Obstruction of fire extinguisher was shown in clean room grader 2 and on the platform of the refrigerator.
Audits.LongName: The facility shall ensure proper measures for fire protection and prevention in all work, rest, dining, and where applicable, housing areas.   This includes but is not limited to:  adequate numbers of functioning fire extinguishers; emergency exits and evacuation routes that are clearly marked, properly lit and kept clear and unlocked while employees are present; proper training and enforcement for handling of flammable liquids and chemicals; and procedures to prevent fires during such activities as welding.

Audits.AuditDetail: Customer complaint records for the most recent complaint, 12/11/17, have not been completed per company procedure.
Audits.LongName: All customer complaints shall be documented.  Records shall include:  the nature of the complaint, investigation, product affected, root cause analysis, corrective and preventive action, product disposition where appropriate, and final complaint resolution.
Audits.Question: All customer complaints shall be documented.  Records shall include:  the nature of the complaint, investigation, product affected, root cause analysis, corrective and preventive action, product disposition where appropriate, and final complaint resolutio

Audits.AuditDetail: The HACCP Plan is not up-to-date as it references documentation from a veterinary company no longer being used by the applicant, rather than Northern Harvest Sea Farms own veterinarians. In Spring 2017, the applicant's farming division hired two veterinarians who  now provide drug declaration documents relevant to CCP 1, Receiving Fresh Atlantic Salmon. The HACCP plan as presented during the audit still  refers to the declarations being provided by the contracted veterinary service previously used by the applicant.
Audits.LongName: All Critical control points shall be properly identified and procedures properly followed in order to control or prevent hazards.
Audits.Question: All Critical control points shall be properly identified and procedures properly followed in order to control or prevent hazards.

Audits.LongName: All critical limits set at each CCP shall be properly identified and followed.  Critical limits shall be based on validated processes, industry standards or scientific and regulatory guidance.
Audits.Question: All critical limits set at each CCP shall be properly identified and followed.  Critical limits shall be based on validated processes, industry standards or scientific and regulatory guidance.

Audits.AuditDetail: Internal audits do not cover all sections of the BAP standard, specifically Section 4, Environmental and Waste Management, and Annex 2, Social Accountability.
Audits.LongName: The Applicant shall have an internal audit system in place that requires self-assessment of the facility's performance against the full scope of the BAP standard, including its Annexes.
Audits.Question: The Applicant shall have an internal audit system in place that requires self-assessment of the facility's performance against the full scope of the BAP standard, including its Annexes.
